sn41.2:4.1: At one time several senior mendicants were staying near Macchikāsaṇḍa in the Wild Mango Grove.
sn41.2:4.2: Then Citta the householder went up to them,
sn41.2:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn41.2:4.5: “Sirs, may the senior mendicants please accept my offering of tomorrow’s meal.”
sn41.2:4.7: Then, knowing that the senior mendicants had accepted, Citta got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled them, keeping them on his right, before leaving.
sn41.2:4.8: Then when the night had passed, the senior mendicants robed up in the morning and, taking their bowls and robes, went to Citta’s home,
sn41.2:4.9: and sat down on the indicated seats.
sn41.2:5.1: Then Citta went up to them,
sn41.2:5.2: bowed, sat down to one side,
sn41.2:5.3: and said to the senior venerable:
sn41.2:5.4: “Sir, they speak of ‘the diversity of elements’.
sn41.2:5.5: In what way did the Buddha speak of the diversity of elements?”
sn41.2:5.6: When he said this, the senior venerable kept silent.
sn41.2:5.11: And for a third time, Citta asked him:
sn41.2:5.12: “Sir, they speak of ‘the diversity of elements’.
sn41.2:5.13: In what way did the Buddha speak of the diversity of elements?”
sn41.2:5.14: And a second time and a third time the senior venerable kept silent.
sn41.2:6.1: Now at that time Venerable Isidatta was the most junior mendicant in that Saṅgha.
sn41.2:6.2: Then Venerable Isidatta said to the senior venerable:
sn41.2:6.7: In what way did the Buddha speak of the diversity of elements?’”
sn41.2:6.9: “This is the diversity of elements spoken of by the Buddha.
sn41.2:6.10: The eye element, the sights element, the eye consciousness element …
sn41.2:6.11: The mind element, the phenomena element, the mind consciousness element.
sn41.2:6.12: This is how the Buddha spoke of the diversity of elements.”
sn41.2:7.1: Then Citta, having approved and agreed with what Isidatta said, served and satisfied the senior mendicants with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods.
sn41.2:7.2: When the senior mendicants had eaten and washed their hands and bowls, they got up from their seats and left.
sn41.2:7.3: Then the senior venerable said to Venerable Isidatta:
sn41.2:7.4: “Isidatta, it’s good that you felt inspired to answer that question, because I didn’t.
sn41.2:7.5: So Isidatta, when a similar question comes up, you should also answer it as you feel inspired.”
